Inconditionnaly disable incoming chat messages.
lc
the core
deny_reason
the deny reason (#LinphoneReasonNone has no effect).

Enable reception of incoming chat messages. By default it is enabled but it can be disabled with linphone_core_disable_chat().
lc
the core
Returns whether chat is enabled.

Returns an list of chat rooms
lc
LinphoneCore object
A list of LinphoneChatRoom objects. LinphoneChatRoom

Get a chat room whose peer is the supplied address. If it does not exist yet, it will be created. No reference is transfered to the application. The LinphoneCore keeps a reference on the chat room.
lc
the linphone core
addr
a linphone address.
LinphoneChatRoom where messaging can take place.

Removes a chatroom including all message history from the LinphoneCore.
lc
The linphone core
to
The chatroom.

Get a chat room for messaging from a sip uri like sip:joe@sip.linphone.org. If it does not exist yet, it will be created. No reference is transfered to the application. The LinphoneCore keeps a reference on the chat room.
lc
The linphone core
to
The destination address for messages.
LinphoneChatRoom where messaging can take place.

Create a message attached to a dedicated chat room;

a new LinphoneChatMessage

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneChatRoom *cr, const char *message, const char *external_body_url, LinphoneChatMessageState state, time_t time, bool_t is_read, bool_t is_incoming)
memberdef.name: linphone_chat_room_create_message_2

detaileddescription.para:
Create a message attached to a dedicated chat room;
cr
the chat room.
message
text message, NULL if absent.
external_body_url
the URL given in external body or NULL.
state
the LinphoneChatMessage.State of the message.
time
the time_t at which the message has been received/sent.
is_read
TRUE if the message should be flagged as read, FALSE otherwise.
is_incoming
TRUE if the message has been received, FALSE otherwise.
a new LinphoneChatMessage

Send a message to peer member of this chat room.
cr
LinphoneChatRoom object
msg
LinphoneChatMessage message to be sent
status_cb
LinphoneChatMessageStateChangeCb status callback invoked when message is delivered or could not be delivered. May be NULL
ud
user data for the status cb.
Deprecated
Use linphone_chat_room_send_chat_message() instead.
The LinphoneChatMessage must not be destroyed until the the callback is called. The LinphoneChatMessage reference is transfered to the function and thus doesn't need to be unref'd by the application.

Send a message to peer member of this chat room.
cr
LinphoneChatRoom object
msg
LinphoneChatMessage object The state of the message sending will be notified via the callbacks defined in the LinphoneChatMessageCbs object that can be obtained by calling linphone_chat_message_get_callbacks(). The LinphoneChatMessage reference is transfered to the function and thus doesn't need to be unref'd by the application.

When realtime text is enabled linphone_call_params_realtime_text_enabled, LinphoneCoreIsComposingReceivedCb is call everytime a char is received from peer. At the end of remote typing a regular LinphoneChatMessage is received with committed data from LinphoneCoreMessageReceivedCb.
msg
LinphoneChatMessage
RFC 4103/T.140 char

Fulfill a chat message char by char. Message linked to a Real Time Text Call send char in realtime following RFC 4103/T.140 To commit a message, use linphone_chat_room_send_message
msg
LinphoneChatMessage
character
T.140 char
0 if succeed.

Notifies the destination of the chat message being composed that the user is typing a new message.
cr
The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation for which a new message is being typed.
Returns a LinphoneChatMessageState as a string.
Returns the chatroom this message belongs to.

User pointer get function

Linphone message can carry external body as defined by rfc2017
message
LinphoneChatMessage
external body url or NULL if not present.
Linphone message can carry external body as defined by rfc2017

Linphone message has an app-specific field that can store a text. The application might want to use it for keeping data over restarts, like thumbnail image path.
message
LinphoneChatMessage
the application-specific data or NULL if none has been stored.
Linphone message has an app-specific field that can store a text. The application might want to use it for keeping data over restarts, like thumbnail image path.
Invoking this function will attempt to update the message storage to reflect the changeif it is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: the data to store into the message
